info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 3:10AM MST until January 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LOCALIZED BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW. ANOTHER ROUND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TODAY... .Gusty southeast winds continues to cause blowing and drifting snow across the Palouse, Pomeroy area, and the Camas Prairie this morning. The threat for blowing and drifting snow will expand north and west toward Ritzville, Davenport, and Airway Heights this morning. Snow that is on the ground now will drift across roads and possibly cause significant visibility reductions. Moderate to heavy snow is falling across portions of Central and Northern Washington and will spread from the Cascades into northeast Washington and north Idaho by Monday morning. Lighter snow accumulations are expected across the Columbia Basin and Spokane-Cd`A Area. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting 35 to 65 mph with the strongest winds near Gifford and Culdesac. * WHERE...Lewiston, Lewiston Grade, Gifford, Lapwai, Culdesac, and Peck. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Some roads in the vicinity of the Lewiston area that are exposed to south winds may experience significant drifting and blowing snow and could result in localized blizzard conditions. Do not attempt to drive on roads that have been closed by local authorities. High winds in eastern Nez Perce County may result in downed power lines and trees.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
